Developer Terms of Use
des:
Scissors Paper Rock (also known as Rock Paper Scissors or RPS) is a hand game usually played between two people, in which each player simultaneously forms one of three shapes with an outstretched hand: rock (a closed fist), paper (a flat hand), or scissors (a fist with the index and middle fingers extended, forming a V-shape). The winner of each round is determined by the rules:

Rock beats scissors
Scissors beat paper
Paper beats rock
If both players choose the same shape, it's a tie and the game is played again.

The game is often used as a method of selection, decision-making, and resolving disputes. It is also used as a simple game for entertainment, and has been adopted in many cultures around the world. The game can be played with any number of players and can be modified to include additional hand gestures or rules to make it more complex or challenging.

In recent years, the game has also been adapted into digital versions, including mobile apps and web-based games. These versions may include additional features such as sound effects, animations, and various themes. Additionally, the game has been incorporated into various other games and activities, such as sports, video games, and even academic studies.
